page.title: 01GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: This is a rural, green-belt area, with restricted building. It is low lying and is mostly agricultural land. There is very little public transport & most inhabitants are car owners. The majority of the houses, which range from terraced to imposing detached residences, are privately owned. However, both Nether Whitacre & Lea Marston have some council owned dwellings. Amenities in the area include two churches, a chapel, a primary school, four public houses, a Working Men's Club, a village hall in both parishes, a church hall (NW), a recreation field , cricket club,hairdressers,garage, Post Office/general store, newsagents, power station with adjoining Nature Reserve,Environmental Centre, Concrete Works, two reservoirs & Waterworks.
